measured_by: difference in number of choices between the most- and least-chosen options
justification: “First, we computed participants’ sampling imbalance as the difference in number of choices between the most- and least-chosen options over the course of each game (Figure 2a).”

measured_by: fraction of re-sampling the same option as a function of previous samples
justification: “First, we computed the fraction of re-sampling from the same option as a function of the number of previous samples acquired from this option (Figure 2b).”
“Second, we computed ‘choice similarity’ matrices – the average similarity of a choice to all later choices in the same game (Figure 2c).”

“We defined as target-congruent choices in direction of the option most likely to be associated with the target colour… As expected, a majority of participants’ choices were target-congruent in the DRAW condition.”
“…and as uncertainty-congruent choices in direction of the option whose associated colour is most uncertain… more choices were uncertainty-congruent in the GUESS condition.”
“Participants’ choices were attracted toward the option most likely to be associated with the target colour in the DRAW condition (Figure 3a; sensitivity parameter tar…).”

“Participants’ choices were sensitive to the difference in information acquired from the two options… The associated sensitivity parameter inf was positive in the DRAW condition but negative in the GUESS condition (Figure 3b).”
“Participants’ choices showed similar (and substantial) repetition biases rep between the DRAW and GUESS conditions (Figure 3c).”

measured_by: initial sampling phase parameters (ini number of samples, ini threshold)
justification: “The model could include an initial sampling phase… This initial sampling strategy is controlled by a number ini of initial samples from each option and a threshold strength ini (see Methods).”
